intro: Clethra brasiliensis var. venosa, commonly known as the white-veined clethra, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy, dark green surface with prominent veins. This evergreen shrub thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture for its beauty and fragrance.
